data.description: An overview of modern photonic technology and an introduction to key parameters and concepts; the basic mechanisms determining the relationship between optical gain and current density, and quantum-well laser structures; physics of high-power phase-locked laser arrays or other optoelectronics devices. Knowledge of electromagnetics [such asE C E 320] and solid-state electronics [such asE C E 335] strongly encouraged.
data.title: SEMICONDUCTOR DIODE LASERS AND OTHER OPTOELECTRONIC DEVICES
